availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Allen S. Brownfield (Mason County carpenter and Union private)

body.p: Mason County, Kentucky, carpenter and soldier. Ohio native. Married to Laura Willet Brownfield. Father of James A. Brownfield, Frances Brownfield, William H. Brownfield. Carpenter in Mason County in 1860. Private in 182nd Ohio Volunteer Infantry (U.S.A.).

ab.bibl: Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Mason County, District 2, p. 96. Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Mason County, Maysville, District 2, p. 145. Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Ohio, Brown County, Aberdeen, p. 62. Organization Index to Pension Files of Veterans who served between 1861 and 1900, Ancestry, Civil War Pensions Index, roll no. T288, p. 58. U.S. National Cemetery Interment Control Forms, 1928-1962, Ancestry, Newport, KY Evergreen Cemetery, 1898.
